thread.title: Soccer: Hardin Valley Academy tops Farragut in semifinals - PrepXtra
thread.title_full: Soccer: Hardin Valley Academy tops Farragut in semifinals - PrepXtra Story

author: News Sentinel staff
title: Soccer: Hardin Valley Academy tops Farragut in semifinals - PrepXtra
text:
Goals by Gwen Breslin and Gabby Powers were enough to push visiting Hardin Valley Academy past Farragut 2-1 for a mild upset in the District 4-AAA soccer semifinals on Tuesday.
Breslin, whose goal came off an assist from Paige Hewitt, gave the Lady Hawks a 1-0 lead, before Powers, assisted by Kelsey Klett, added the necessary insurance to fend off elimination. The win avenges HVA's 3-1 loss to Farragut on Aug. 26. Grace Sommi scored the Lady Admirals only goal in the second half.
Hardin Valley will take on Maryville in Thursday's final.
District 2-AAA
South-Doyle 5, Seymour 1: Bailey Gale posted a hat trick as the Lady Cherokees advanced to Thursday's 6 p.m. final against Jefferson County.
East/Middle Region District I
Webb 1, Donelson Christian 1: Tournament MVP Evey Satterfield made the game-clinching save to give Webb a 7-6 edge after two rounds of penalty kicks. The Lady Spartans (13-1-2) raced to a 1-0 lead in regulation on Avery Catlett's first-half goal, assisted by Abby Bailey. An own goal by Webb tied the match in the second half. Webb will play host to St. Cecilia in the first round of the East/Middle Region tournament on Thursday at 4:30 p.m.
District 4-A/AA
CAK 5, Alcoa 0: Emily Threatt scored twice as the Lady Warriors (14-4) cruised in their semifinal. Addy Cronan, Hannah Clothier and Eva Toler also scored for CAK, which will play host to Catholic in Thursday's 6:30 p.m. final.
Catholic 3, Oneida 0: Sam Peck scored two goals and Renee Semaan added another as the host Lady Irish advanced.
District 3-A/AA
Grace Christian 2, Carter 1: Junior forward Allie Dunn scored the game-winning goal off an assist from Sara Houff as the Lady Rams (13-4-1) advanced.
Her goal helped Grace Christian, which will take on Rockwood in Thursday's 6:30 p.m. final, erase a 1-0 halftime deficit. Lauren Lewis also scored in the second half.
